entry.title: United Nations General Assembly Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to one account, planners put a dome above the United Nations General Assembly Building (interior pictured) so the UN headquarters could be funded more quickly?

entry.title: Kai Bumann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the German conductor Kai Bumann was the music director of the Warsaw Chamber Opera, and toured Japan with the company twice?

entry.title: Rubicon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the genetic deletion of the protein Rubicon increases the lifespan of roundworms and female fruit flies?

entry.title: Creekfinding (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Creekfinding was inspired by epidemiologist Michael Osterholm's efforts to restore a creek that had been diverted decades earlier?

entry.title: John Jarvis-Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when the British government discovered that John Jarvis-Smith was not dead, they gave him a medal?

entry.title: their 2019 football game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Alabama Crimson Tide's loss to the LSU Tigers in their 2019 football game broke a 31-game home winning streak?

entry.title: Pinwill sisters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the woodcarver Violet Pinwill of the Pinwill sisters was still working on a life-size figure of Saint Peter days before her death in 1957, aged 82?

entry.title: Schiller Woods magic water pump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some regular users of the Schiller Woods magic water pump near Chicago believe that it was covertly blessed by Pope John Paul II in 1979?
